title: False results of gene test kits can frighten people, doctors warn
text:
DIY gene testing kits are falsely scaring young people into believing they will develop cancer and other diseases, senior doctors have warned.

The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) said members are dealing with growing numbers of frightened patients who have bought the tests on the high street or online.

The kits, which collect genetic samples using a mouth swab, offer a wealth of apparent data, including the likelihood of developing serious illnesses.

However, studies have shown they are prone to misleading results, including ones that leave patients believing they can live an unhealthy lifestyle with no risk of disease.

Dr Imran Rafi, a lecturer at St George’s University of London, and the college’s genomics spokesman, said that when he took one popular test, the results informed him he had only a very small chance of losing his hair.

He is almost entirely bald.
description: DIY gene testing kits are falsely scaring young people into believing they will develop cancer and other diseases, senior doctors have warned.
